node.text: Day 2 of our Tiger Shark Expedition and we have already encountered 12 Tiger sharks, 2 Thresher sharks, Black tip, Silver tip and White tip reef sharks!! We are now on our way to do our 2nd Tiger shark dive, stay tuned on our story for details! It is 30 degrees Celsius in the water and the weather has been gorgeous! What a beautiful time to be here, email us at info@discoversharkstours.com to join our next expedition September 18th - 25th, limited space available! Let’s go! 🦈 #discoversharksexpeditions

node.text:
One day she was swimming in the ocean, the next she was torn away & imprisoned by humans. 

More people have taken action to #FreeLolita from Miami Seaquarium than the whole population of #Miami! Tap the link in @peta’s profile to join them tomorrow for the first day of her 5️⃣1️⃣st year in captivity: https://peta.vg/375c

node.text:
We are beyond excited to announce the launch of our first MALDIVES expeditions!

You will be fully accommodated with 3 Dives per day to encounter Tresher Sharks, Tiger Sharks, Whale Sharks and Mantas, food and Non Alcoholic drinks, also your participation will support local businesses and ocean conservation organizations! The expedition will be broadcast live on @discoversharks 🎥Click the link in our bio for more details 
📧: DM your email address to @discoversharkstours if you’re ready to book your spot!
Video by @tannerunderwater

node.text:
Join @discoversharks this September in the Maldives for our Whale Shark Expedition! We will
Explore SOUTH ARI ATOLL, known as the “Whale Shark Capital of the World”. We are partnering with @island_divers for another epic adventure. You will be fully accommodated with rooms, food, and transportation. Click the link in bio for more information 📩 email tours@discoversharks.com to book your spot ! - feel free to contact us with any questions as well! We are now excepting reservations, get your spot now! 🔥 📷 by @jalilnajafov

node.title: Join us at The Maldives Whale Shark Capitol of the World!

node.text: This is the most tragic thing I’ve ever filmed: a pod of dolphins swimming through a giant oil spill. The spill is spanning an area covering more than 50 miles, and it is lurking just off the coast of San Diego. On today’s extended trip we made our way to our reliable Blue Whale hotspot near San Clemente Island and we were shocked when the whales seemingly vanished. Just 24 hours earlier this zone was full of the feeding giants. It was then that we began making our way south, and soon made this shocking discovery. Tragic doesn’t begin to cover it. For more than 50 miles the ocean was covered in a thick sheen of oil, a devastating tragedy for the environment. We know very little at this time, and we are trying to make these images go viral in hopes of getting some answers as to how this happened. More shocking yet, 70+ miles away back in coastal San Diego, the local whale watching boats reported an area thick with oil encroaching on the local waters as well. I truly hope this isn’t as bad as it appears, but if this oil is already in an area that spans at a minimum of 70 miles, we could have a catastrophe of unimaginable scale on our hands. Please share this video with your followers and tag people, celebrities, influencers and news media that need to see and share it too: WE NEED ANSWERS BEFORE ANY MORE MARINE LIFE SUFFERS! We’ve reached out to NOAA, the Coast Guard, and the EPA. We hope to have an update soon. Video and caption by our friend @dolphindronedom #saveouroceans

node.text:
PLEASE TAKE ACTION NOW! A seemingly small action today really will help make a historical change to HELP SAVE SHARKS in Hawaii! We’ve been pretty quiet about this on social media til this point but it is now the FINAL step to getting sharks fully protected in Hawaii! 

Please lend them your voice by writing into to the Governor of Hawaii today via the link in the bio @oneoceanconservation and ask him to : “PROTECT SHARKS by please SUPPORTING and signing HB553 into law.”

The link is in the bio of @oneoceanconservation 

and I have a good feeling this is the year that manō (sharks) in Hawaii get the protection that they need, deserve, and traditionally were given. Lets protect sharks everywhere we can and for me it’s significant to see the manō I have grown up with (who have taught me so much) get protection from purposeful killing, capture, entanglement, and harm. 

Video of Roxy, I’m grateful she seems to visit me around my birthday, the holidays, and when she needs debris like this net and fishing line removed. This law will help to reduce nets in shark nursery habitats (nets like the ones we’ve cut off her several times) and hopefully save other sharks from broken jaws like hers as it will be a fineable offense to purposely (not accidentally) capture or kill a shark. This law won’t criminalize accidental capture, but it will mean that fisherman must let a shark go if they realize they do accidentally capture a shark, which responsible fishermen already do. 

LINK IN BIO @OneOceanConservation PLEASE SUPPORT THE PROTECTION OF SHARKS TODAY. Mahalo nui loa. Malamamano Respect and protect sharks. 
Special thanks to the many organizations, individuals, reps, and senators who have been helping support this bill all along the way and for many years now. #ForManō #HelpSaveSharks #protectsharks #SaveTheOcean

node.text:
Please take a moment to help stop this by signing the petition in @oceancreature23’s bio ‼️This happened yesterday in Fish Head Ari Atoll, one of the most popular dive sites in the Maldives. And now the government opened discussions to legalize shark fishing. Shark fishing was banned since 2010 after the shark population was destroyed almost to the point of no return. Only recently sharks have started to come back to some areas and if they allow it to happen again sharks will be gone in just a matter of few months. Lets pressure the government to stop this. Pls tag these accounts and share as much as you can.... @presidentmohamednasheed 
@presidencymv @epamaldives 
@mofmramv 
.
.
Video by @pauwels.thomas 
Shark fin photos by Maldives Customs

node.text:
A saltie (saltwater crocodile) uses his buddy to demonstrate a perfect deathroll for the humans in attendance.

I'm not sure what the guy with the paddle was attempting to accomplish, but this footage also features a guy with a paddle.

Here's something I didn't know until 8 minutes ago: There are more crocodiles residing in Australia's Northern Territory than anywhere else in the world.

node.text:
After freediving with Tiger Sharks, Our Expedition has come to an end, extraordinary and unforgettable just like @aussieelise here had an extraordinary encounter filmed by @pelagicdivefuvahmulah 

if you still want to join our second Tiger Shark expedition it will be 18th - 25th of Sep 2021, DM @discoversharkstours with your email address for more info.

node.text:
〰️ Maldives Tiger Shark Expedition 〰️

we’ve spent seven days diving the island of Fuvahmulah trip, Maldives with our incredible team @alexsharks_  @tannerunderwater @sharkgirlmadison @zimydakid @jalilnajafov @inahdm @khaled_w_als @aussieelise @hboyer2 @qutaiba_ @strohc45 Davi @pelagicdivefuvahmulah @ahmed.hamdhan @ashhalashhal @hissantey 🦈

Swimming with sharks is something really special but to share the space with Tiger sharks is amazing, a selfless feeling,

Video by @ahmed.hamdhan 

Today this 1st Tiger Shark expedition comes to an end, tomorrow we will be traveling to Male the capital of Maldives and then take a speed boat to Dhigurah Island, and so our Whale Sharks & Mantas expedition begins. Stay tuned @discoversharkstours @discoversharks #maldives #maldivestours #sharklovers #tigersharkst

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by DISCOVER SHARKS on September 07, 2021 tagging @tannerunderwater, and @discoversharkstours. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'TIGER SHARK EXPEDITION 18 25 SEPTEMBER 2021'.

node.text:
Only a few spots left in our 2nd Maldives Shark Expedition! Don’t Miss Out!

🎉🦈 
We are beyond excited to announce our second MALDIVES expeditions! In collaboration with @pelagicdivefuvamulah 🦈

You will be fully accommodated with 3 Dives per day to encounter Tresher Sharks, Tiger Sharks, Whale Sharks and Mantas, food and Non Alcoholic drinks, also your participation will support local businesses and ocean conservation organizations! The expedition will be broadcast live on @discoversharks 🎥
📧: DM  @discoversharkstours to get more details or click the link in our bio 👆🏽

Save the date! 
September 1st - 8th 2021 

📩 ( Tours@discoversharks.com )
📷  by @tannerunderwater

node.text:
Words by @zimydakid X MALDIVIAN TIGERS X

It’s been such an amazing week this far.

Diving every single day with loads of Tiger Sharks and an awesome and inspiring group of divers / creators / conservationists.

Tomorrow will be our last day diving with Tiger Sharks here before moving on to another island where we’ll be looking for Whale Sharks and Manta Rays !

🦈🦈🦈

#maldives #fuvahmulah #tigershark #tigersharks #discoversharks #discoverocean #shark #sharks #scuba #underwaterphotography #roam247 #oceanconservation #sharkconservation #ikelite #sonya7siii

SEP 18th - 25th 2021
DM your email to @discoversharkstours for more Info.
